input.description:
The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Valid value: NetApp
Size of storage to be provisioned.
Valid Values: KB, MB, GB, TB

[Required only for NetApp]
NetApp: Name of the storage service based on which the storage has to be provisioned.

[Required only for NetApp]
NetApp: Type of storage to be provisioned.
valid values: nas. san
[optional] NetApp: -Specifies name or id of the vFiler unit.

[Required only for EMC]
EMC: Raid level
[Required only for EMC] EMC: Specifies whether to create lun or Raid group or thin pool Valid values RG or TP

[Requried only for EMC]
EMC: Name of the Storage System

NetApp: [required if dynamic targeting is used otherwise optional]
Designates a specific target (name of the DFM server where the operation will be performed) that has been defined in the adapter configuration. Valid value- Same value that has been specified for the name attribute of 'config' element in the adapter configuration . If this tag is left empty the request will be executed on the first defined adapter configuration.
for e.g for the adapter config below , target would be 02. <configs> <config name="02"> <target>172.19.224.103</target> <user-name>root</user-name> <password>bmcbmc</password> <protocol>http</protocol> <port>8088</port> </config> </configs>
Dynamic targeting: Host name or IP address of DFM.
EMC:- [optional] Specifies the connection information for EMC SMI-S Provider. - Default value: All defined adapter configuration.

NetApp: [required only if dynamic targeting is used] NetApp DataFabric Manager login username.
EMC:- [optional] Specifies the login name used to connect to EMC SMI-S Provider. The 'username' specified in adapter request overrides the value specified in adapter configuration. - Valid value: None. - Default Value: None.

NetApp: [required only if dynamic targeting is used] NetApp DataFabric Manager login password.
EMC :- [optional] Specifies the password used to connect to EMC SMI-S Provider. The 'password' specified in adapter request overrides the value specified in adapter configuration. - Valid value: None. - Default Value: None.
NetApp: [Conditional] specified only when password parameter is mentioned . You can encrypt the password by specifying the encryption type . Valid values: Base64,Plain.

NetApp: [Optional and used when dynamic targeting] Communication protocol used by adapter. Valid value is http or https. Default value is http.
EMC:- [optional] Specifies the protocol used to connect to EMC SMI-S Provider. The 'protocol' specified in adapter request overrides the value specified in adapter configuration. - Valid value: HTTPS or HTTP - Default Value: None.

NetApp: [Optional and used when dynamic targeting] Port on which NetApp DataFabric Manager is enabled. Default value is 8088 for http protocol and 8488 for https protocol.
EMC:- [optional] Specifies the port number used to connect to EMC SMI-S Provider. The 'port' specified in adapter request overrides the value specified in adapter configuration. - Valid value: A valid numeric value. - Default Value: None.

[optional] EMC: - Specifies the time in seconds after which the attempt to connect to EMC SMI-S provider times out. The 'timeout-secs' specified in adapter request overrides the value specified in adapter configuration. - Valid value: A numeric value which specifies the time in seconds. - Default Value: 180, if no 'timeout-secs' is provided .

output.description:
String Value - Indicates whether or not the process completed successfully.
Valid values: success or failure
Applicable for NetApp, EMC

String Value - A process specific explanation for the value of success status. Contains the error message in case of a failure scenario.
Applicable for NetApp, EMC
NetApp : Name of the storage container on top of which the storage is provisioned.

NetApp:Name of the provisioned storage.
EMC: Name of the Lun
Applicable for NetApp, EMC

NetApp: Path of the created storage:
Example: /vol/sc1/lun1/lun1
EMC: Name of the raid group/ thin pool . Example raid gorup 0000
Applicable for NetApp, EMC
NetApp : Name or IP of the NetApp Filer on which the storage has been provisioned. Applicable for NetApp Only

Output of the provisioning actions. Includes job details.
Applicable for NetApp, EMC

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <items> <item> <xsl:if test="string-length('${target}')>0 and string-length('${username}') =0"> <target> <xsl:value-of select="'${target}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </target> </xsl:if> <force> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">true</xsl:text> </force> <vfiler-name-or-id>${vFiler}</vfiler-name-or-id> <dataset-name-or-id> <xsl:value-of select="." disable-output-escaping="no" /> </dataset-name-or-id> <xsl:if test="string-length('${target}')>0 and string-length('${username}') > 0"> <targets> <target> <host> <xsl:value-of select="'${target}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </host> <user-name>${username}</user-name> <password> <xsl:attribute name="encryption-type"> <xsl:value-of select="'${encryption type}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:attribute> <xsl:value-of select="'${password}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </password> <xsl:if test="string-length('${protocol}') >0"> <protocol>${protocol}</protocol> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${port}') >0"> <port>${port}</port> </xsl:if> </target> </targets> </xsl:if> </item> </items> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('${storage type}') = 'san' or string('${storage type}') = 'SAN'"> <storage> <name>${storage name}</name> <storage-container-name-or-id>${storage container}</storage-container-name-or-id> <size>${size}</size> <maximum-snapshot-space> <xsl:number value="0" /> </maximum-snapshot-space> </storage> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <storage> <name>${storage name}</name> <storage-container-name-or-id>${storage container}</storage-container-name-or-id> <size>${size}</size> <maximum-snapshot-space> <xsl:number value="0" /> </maximum-snapshot-space> <dataset-export-info> <dataset-export-protocol> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">mixed</xsl:text> </dataset-export-protocol> <dataset-nfs-export-setting> <is-readonly-for-all-hosts> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">false</xsl:text> </is-readonly-for-all-hosts> <nfs-protocol-version> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">v3</xsl:text> </nfs-protocol-version> <anonymous-access-user> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">65534</xsl:text> </anonymous-access-user> <disable-setuid> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">true</xsl:text> </disable-setuid> <is-readwrite-for-all-hosts> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">true</xsl:text> </is-readwrite-for-all-hosts> </dataset-nfs-export-setting> <dataset-cifs-export-setting> <dataset-cifs-share-permissions> <dataset-cifs-share-permission> <permission> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">full_control</xsl:text> </permission> <cifs-username> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">Everyone</xsl:text> </cifs-username> </dataset-cifs-share-permission> </dataset-cifs-share-permissions> </dataset-cifs-export-setting> </dataset-export-info> </storage> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

<xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <value> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string('${storage type}') = 'san' or string('${storage type}') = 'SAN'"> <xsl:value-of select="concat("/vol","/${storage container}/${storage name}/${storage name}")" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:when test="string('${storage type}') = 'nas' or string('${storage type}') = 'NAS'"> <xsl:value-of select="concat("/vol","/${storage container}/${storage name}")" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:value-of select="concat("/vol","/${storage name}")" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </value> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

input.value: has been successfully created on storage container "

output.value: The given storage system does not contain any raid group or thin pool

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <storage-pool> <xsl:for-each select="//storage-pool"> <xsl:if test="string(./raid-level) = '${raid level}'"> <xsl:if test="number(./available-capacity-bytes) > number($[storage size])"> <xsl:if test="'${pool type}' ='TP'"> <xsl:copy-of select="./thin-pool" /> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="'${pool type}' = 'RG'"> <xsl:copy-of select="./raid-group" /> </xsl:if> </xsl:if> </xsl:if> </xsl:for-each> </storage-pool> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

output.value: No Raid group or thin pool found of the given raid level and given size

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <storage> <storage-system-name> <xsl:value-of select="'${storage system}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </storage-system-name> <xsl:if test="name(storage-pool/child::*)= 'raid-group'"> <raid-group> <xsl:value-of select="storage-pool/child::*" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </raid-group> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="name(storage-pool/child::*)= 'thin-pool'"> <thin-pool> <xsl:value-of select="storage-pool/child::*" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </thin-pool> </xsl:if> <size> <xsl:value-of select="'${size}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </size> <storage-unit> <xsl:value-of select="'${storage unit}'" disable-output-escaping="no" /> </storage-unit> </storage> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

documentation.description:
NetApp: This actions provisions san/nas type storage based on the input storage service. - Storage type is decided based on the provsioning policy in the storage service. - If there are storage containers associated with the storage service, then the storage is provisioned on the first storage container in the list. Else, a new storage container is created and the concerned storage service is attached to it. - There should exist a vFiler of the same name as the storage service which will be associated with the storage container. - The storage will be provisioned on this storage container. Dynamic targeting:Ability to communicate with multiple DFM servers which are not configured under the adapter configuration. NetApp action can be invoked using dynamic targeting / without dynamic targeting.
When Dynamic targeting is used : target would be Host name or IP address of server on which NetApp DataFabric Manager is running. It is mandatory send all the required parameters: username, password , encyption type when using dynamic targeting.
When Dynamic targeting is not used : Designates a specific target (name of the DFM server where the operation will be performed) that has been defined in the adapter configuration. Valid value- Same value that has been specified for the name attribute of 'config' element in the adapter configuration . If this tag is left empty the request will be executed on the first defined adapter configuration.
for e.g for the adapter config below , target would be 02. <configs> <config name="02"> <target>172.19.224.103</target> <user-name>root</user-name> <password>bmcbmc</password> <protocol>http</protocol> <port>8088</port> </config> </configs>
EMC: This action provides san based storage based of the given raid level and pool type on a given storage system. Pool type should be either RG or TP. If there is a raid gorup/ thin pool of the given raid level and able to accomadate given size , corresponding storage pool is selected and a lun is created over it.
Dynamic targeting: Ability to communicate with multiple SMIS-providers which are not configured under the adapter configuration. EMC action can be invoked using dynamic targeting / without dynamic targeting.
When Dynamic targeting is used : target would be Host name or IP address of server on which EMC SMIS provider is running. It is mandatory send all the required parameters: username, password , protocol port when using dynamic targeting.
When Dynamic targeting is not used : target specifies the connection information for EMC SMI-S Provider. - Valid value: The value specified for <target> element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in the adapter configuration. You can leave this tag empty. In this case the request will be executed on all the defined adapter configuration. - Default value: All defined adapter configuration. For e.g for the adapter config below , target would be 03. <configs> <config name="03"> <target> 10.128.28.59</target> <user-name>emcuser</user-name> <password>bmcbmc</password> <protocol>https</protocol> <port> 5989</port> </config> </configs>
